message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SY. 

The paper focuses on improving the ability of recurrent units to learn structured representations, which is a common problem in natural language processing (NLP) and artificial intelligence (AI) research. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are the most likely sub-categories. The use of Tensor Product Representations (TPRs) and the incorporation of structural information into learning also suggest that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are relevant sub-categories. Finally, the explicit execution of binding and unbinding operations in the proposed TPRU recurrent unit involves manipulating symbolic structure, which is a topic in cs.SY (Systems and Control).
